required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Hyaluronan-enriched Medium on the Cumulative Ongoing Pregnancy Rate.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Hyaluronan-enriched Medium on the Cumulative Ongoing Pregnancy Rate: a Prospective Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Assessing whether the use of hyaluronan-enriched transfer medium can increase the cumulative ongoing pregnancy rate

primary_outcome.measure: number of transfers needed to reach ongoing pregnancy
primary_outcome.time_frame: ongoing defined as a pregancy with a viable fetus with FHB at 12 weeks of pregnancy
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome parameter is the number of transfers needed to reach ongoing pregnancy (ongoing defined as a pregancy with a viable fetus with FHB at 12 weeks of pregnancy), as a time-to-event outcome variable. Patients that do not reach pregnancy, are censored at their last transfer.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of transfers needed to reach clinical pregnancy, life birth, miscarriage, multiple pregnancy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: until Live birth: 9 months after ET
secondary_outcome.description: clinical pregnancy is defined as a pregnancy with at least one intrauterine (IU) or extrauterine (EU) fetal sac at 6-7 weeks of pregnancy)

arm_group.description: Patients receiving an embryo transfer in hyaluronan-enriched transfer medium
Patients receiving an embryo transfer in conventional culture medium

intervention.description: In the study group, an embryo transfer will be performed in hyaluronan-enriched transfer medium
